description: The following are incident and offense reports from municipal police departments in Shelby County from April 3 through May 19:. -Theft of property fourth degree, criminal trespass third degree from the 2200 block of Kent Dairy Road. -Domestic incident from the 1500 block of Kent Dairy Road.
text:
The following are incident and offense reports from municipal police
departments in Shelby County from April 3 through May 19:

Alabaster

May 12

-Domestic violence third degree, assault from the 10 block of 13th Avenue Southeast.

-Information only from the 700 block of Fourth Avenue Northwest.

-Information only from the 800 block of Barkley Drive.

-Theft of property fourth degree, criminal trespass third degree from the 2200 block of Kent Dairy Road. Clothes/furs were stolen.

-Information only from the 100 block of Falling Waters Lane.

-Information only from the 100 block of Summer Hill Drive.

-Animal complaint from the 100 block of Star View Circle.

-Animal complaint from the 100 block of Forest Hills Road.

-Domestic incident from the 1500 block of Kent Dairy Road.

May 13

-Information only from the 10400 block of Shelby County 17, Maylene.

-Information only from the 100 block of Barkley Circle. A silver ice bucket valued at $300, antique stereo cabinet valued at $200 and Dell computer valued at $4,500 were stolen.

-Harassment or harassing communications from the 200 block of Cloverdale Circle.

-Animal complaint from the 300 block of Willow Glen Drive.

-Identity theft from the 100 block of Washington Lane.

-Animal complaint from the 300 block of Willow Glen Drive.

-Domestic violence third degree, interference with a domestic violence emergency call from the 100 block of Lucas Lane.

-Information only from the 200 block of Cedar Meadow. Flower pots valued at $100 were stolen.

-Information only from the 1600 block of Mission Hills Road.

-Assault second degree, domestic violence second degree from the 900 block of U.S. 31.

May 14

-Information only from the 9900 block of Alabama 119.

-Death investigation from the 1200 block of Michael Drive.

-Harassment from the 1400 block of Windsor Court.

-Death investigation from the 100 block of Paddington Station.

-Domestic incident from the 1200 block of Windsor Court.

-Domestic incident from the 1000 block of Colonial Drive.

May 15

-Domestic incident from the 100 block of Goldwire Place.

-Harassment or harassing communications from the 60 block of Peavine Trailer Park.

-Information only from the 100 block of Tintern Abbey.

-Theft of property fourth degree from the 300 block of Colonial Promenade Parkway. New Balance shoes valued at $49.99 were stolen.

-Theft of property fourth degree from the 300 block of 13th Street Southwest. A plant with a flower pot valued at $100 was stolen.

-Suicide attempt from Windsor Court.

-Domestic violence third degree, criminal mischief second degree from the 600 block of Ninth Court Southwest. A 2016 Nissan Rouge sustained $501 in damages.

May 16

-Information only from the 1300 block of Third Avenue Southwest.

-Property damage from the 2500 block of Windsor Court. A 2015 Ford Fusion sustained $1,500 in damages.

-Criminal trespass second degree from the 100 block of 11th Street Northwest.

-Animal complaint from the 100 block of Palm Drive.

-Discharging firearm in city from the 1300 block of Third Avenue Southwest.

May 17

-Information only from the 300 block of Lacey Avenue.

-Dog bite, violation of leash law from the 300 block of Mardis Lane.

-Discharging firearm into occupied dwelling or vehicle from the 200 block of Kensington Lane. A double-pane window valued at $400 was damaged.

-Animal complaint from the 90 block of Washington Lane.

-Criminal mischief third degree from the 8500 block of Shelby County 17\. A storage building sustained $300 in damages.

-Information only from the 400 block of Rock View Trace.

-Domestic violence third degree, harassment or harassing communications from the 1000 block of Balmoral Drive.

May 18

-Theft of lost property fourth degree, lost property from Butler Road. Wallets, documents, various cards and $22 in money were stolen.

-Criminal mischief third degree from the 700 block of Fifth Avenue Southeast. A 2010 Chevy Camaro sustained $200 in damages.

-Harassment or harassing communications from the 1200 block of First Street North.

-Theft of services from the 100 block of Buck Creek Plaza. Food valued at $198.15 was stolen.

-Trespassing notice from the 9200 block of Alabama 119.

-Identity theft from the 200 block of 13th Street Southwest.

-Unauthorized use of vehicle from the 100 block of Allen Drive. A 2017 Nissan Altima valued at $18,000 was stolen.

-Domestic incident from the 200 block of First Street North.

-Domestic violence-harassment from the 1100 block of King Arthur Court.

-Welfare check from the 800 block of Third Street Northeast.

-Information only from the 100 block of King Arthur Place.

Calera

May 11

-Failure to appear (two counts) from the 10900 block of Alabama 25.

-Agency assist from Alabama 25 and the 228-mile marker of I-65 North.

-Identity theft from the 200 block of Saratoga Lane.

-DUI-alcohol from the 226-mile marker of I-65 North.

-Property damage from Savannah Pointe.

-Incident from the 100 block of Rossburg Drive.

-Agency assist from the 5100 block of Supercenter Drive.

-Discharging firearm in city from U.S. 31 at Shelby County 6.

-DUI from I-65 North.

May 12

-Incident from the 100 block of Rossburg Drive.

-Failure to appear from the 300 block of McDow Road, Columbiana.

-Failure to appear from the 100 block of Mildred Street, Columbiana.

-Domestic incident from the 100 block of Moss Stone Lane.

-Domestic incident from the 300 block of Savannah Circle.

May 13

-Domestic violence third degree-harassment from the 1000 block of Long Branch Parkway.

-Additional information from the 1000 block of Long Branch Parkway.

-Incident from the 100 block of Rossburg Drive.

May 14

-Burglary third degree-residence from the 200 block of Leonards Court, Montevallo.

-Theft of property fourth degree from the 200 block of Leonards Court, Montevallo.

-Criminal trespassing third degree from the 10900 block of Alabama 25.

May 15

-Illegally obtaining credit or debit card, theft of property third degree from the 100 block of Little John Circle.

-Possession of a controlled substance-dangerous drugs from Alabama 25 at I-65 North.

-Animal complaint from the 200 block of Stonecreek Place.

-Agency assist from the 1400 block of 20th Avenue.

May 16

-Failure to appear from I-65 North.

-Possession of drug paraphernalia, possession of a controlled substance-meth, possession of marijuana second degree, giving false ID to law enforcement officer, escape second degree from I-65 North.

-Receiving stolen property first degree from the 5100 block of U.S. 31.

-Receiving stolen property first degree from the 5100 block of U.S. 31.

-Incident from the 90 block of Southern Hills Parkway.

-Possession of drug paraphernalia, possession of a controlled substance-meth, possession of marijuana second degree from Shelby County 42 and Alabama 25.

-Lost property from the 100 block of Rossburg Drive.

May 17

-Menacing-aggravated assault from the 100 block of Clearbrook Lane.

-Theft of property fourth degree-shoplifting from the 5100 block of U.S. 31.

-Theft of property fourth degree from the 70 block of Shelby County 63 Lot 4.

-Incident from the 900 block of 10th Street.

Harpersville

April 3

-Theft of property from vehicle from the 10000 block of Gallups Crossroads.

April 4

-Domestic incident from the 300 block of Farmingdale Lane.

-Domestic incident from the 300 block of Farmingdale Lane.

April 8

-Criminal mischief from the 10 block of Richey Court.

April 9

-Property damage from the 2400 block of U.S. 280.

April 15

-Death investigation from the 10 block of Cottonwood Circle.

April 21

-Violation of dog ordinance from the 37000 block of Alabama 25.

April 22

-Harassing communications from the 2500 block of Dead Hollow Road.

April 26

-Burglary of church from the 38000 block of Alabama 25.

April 27

-Domestic violence third degree from the 10 block of Ridgewood Drive.

April 28

-Incident from the 10 block of Pine Street.

Helena

May 11

-Police canine activity from I-65 South Exit 231.

-Police canine activity from Fieldstone Drive.

-Lost property from an unnamed location in Helena.

-Civil dispute from an undisclosed victim's residence.

May 12

-Miscellaneous information from an undisclosed victim's residence.

May 13

-Domestic incident from Woodvale Drive.

-Possession of marijuana second degree from Shelby County 270, Coalmont Road.

May 14

-Police canine activity from Shelby County 52 East, Alabaster.

May 15

-Death investigation from the 2200 block of Pup Run.

-Theft of property first degree from Country Side Lane, Bessemer.

May 16

-Miscellaneous information from Fieldstone Circle.

-Possession of marijuana second degree from River Crest Drive North.

May 17

-Civil dispute from Lakeland Trail.

Montevallo

May 11

-Information only from Highway 25 (service/gas station).

May 13

-Information only from Montevallo (other/unknown).

-Information only from Hicks Street (residence/home).

May 14

-Property damage from Valley Street (highway/street). Damaged was driver's door valued at $150.

-Information only from Overland Road (residence/home).

May 15

-Dangerous drugs-POM 2 possession of marijuana from Montevallo (highway/street). Confiscated was marijuana 10 grams; Kiwi pear green tea canister containing marijuana valued at $1.

-Weapons-possession of a concealed weapon without a permit from Highway 25 (highway/street). Confiscated was an RG23 .22CAL and a Remington 870 12GA valued at $300.

-Dangerous drugs-PDP drug paraphernalia-1st offense and dangerous drugs-POM 2 possession of marijuana from AL-119 (field/woods). Confiscated was marijuana 1.00 not reported; marijuana and wooden marijuana container and pipe valued at $30.

-Obstruction-violation of a domestic violence protection order from Jones Road (residence/home).

-Dangerous drugs-synthetic narcotic-possession from Montevallo (highway/street). Confiscated was other narcotics 9.40 grams; 9.4 grams of synthetic marijuana valued at $100.

May 16

-Dangerous drugs-POM 2 possession of marijuana and liquor-OCV container-alcohol in a vehicle from Montevallo (highway/street). Confiscated was marijuana 1.60 grams and S&W 9MM valued at $350.

-Dangerous drugs-PDP drug paraphernalia-1st offense and dangerous drugs-methamphetamine-possess from AL Highway 25 (convenient store). Confiscated was amphetamines/methamphetamines 2.00 grams; clear baggy containing 2.0 grams of methampheramine and glass smoking pipe valued at $35.

-Information only from Overland Road (residence/home).

May 17

-Property damage from Revolutionary Way (residence/home). Damaged was kitchen cabinets, kitchen stove and microwave oven valued at $11,000.

-Assault-simple assault from County Road 22 (residence/home).

May 19

-Information only from Skyview Drive (parking lot/garage). Recovered was shell casings valued at $0.07.

-Information only from Cambridge Park Drive (residence/home).

-Information only from Main Street (government/public building).

Pelham

May 10

-Assault from the 100 Block of Oliver Street (parking lot/garage). Stolen, not recovered was cash valued at $400.

May 11

-Theft from the 2000 Block of Valleydale Terrace (commercial/office building). Stolen, not recovered were tools valued at $3,000.

-Theft of a vehicle from the 200 Block of Cahaba Valley Parkway (parking lot/garage). Stolen localled/recovered other was an auto valued at $1.

May 13

-Miscellaneous from the 100 Block of Kilberry Circle (residence/home). Confiscated/seized was a rifle valued at $500.

May 14

-Fraud from the 3100 Block of Pelham Parkway (Home Depot) (specialty store). Stolen, not recovered was cash valued at $257.19.

* Twitter

* Facebook

title: Police reports for the week of May 24, 2020
html:
The following are incident and offense reports from municipal police departments in Shelby County from April 3 through May 19:

Alabaster

May 12

-Domestic violence third degree, assault from the 10 block of 13th Avenue Southeast.

-Information only from the 700 block of Fourth Avenue Northwest.

-Animal complaint from the 100 block of Star View Circle.

-Theft of property fourth degree from the 300 block of Colonial Promenade Parkway. New Balance shoes valued at $49.99 were stolen.
